H0.text: when did beryl markham fly across the atlantic. August 1935

H1.text: when did beryl markham fly across the atlantic. July 1937

H2.text: when did beryl markham fly across the atlantic. May 1934

H3.text: when did beryl markham fly across the atlantic. September 1936

A4.text: On 4 September 1936 she took off from Abingdon in southern England; her intended destination was Floyd Bennett Field in Brooklyn, New York, but after a 20‑hour flight her Percival Vega Gull VP‑KCC named The Messenger, suffered fuel starvation due to icing of the fuel tank vents, and she made a forced landing at Baleine Cove on Cape Breton Island, Nova Scotia, Canada.
